author: Studded_Dud
title: All about the Nixel
review:
Build: The building experience isn't very exciting. It includes a lot of repetition, but is pretty quick which is expected for a set this size. It isn't advertised that you get a Nixel in the set until you already have built the main Mixel, so that is a nice surprise and about the best part of the set.

Parts: The parts are pretty generic. It has a few good hinge elements and two printed eyes, but other than that there's lots of studs and bland pieces.

Playability: There are 5 points of action on the Mixel and 3 on the Nixel. The Mixel has on that moves the head up and down, two for the arms which are clips so there's not much movement there, the legs are ball joint's and swivel around very well which is the main source of play. The Nixel has a nice little chair thing that it sits on and that has two bars that go up and down. There is also a swivel feature on the bottom of the chair so the Nixel can swing to his heart's desire.

Value For Money: The original price was $4.99, €3.99, which I think is very good considering the fact that the set has 74 pieces, includes a surprise Nixel, and the package is a pollybag. Overall this is a set that gets hidden in any collection and but is worth it for the price.
